definition: to help with farm work/casual laborer
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: He then closed, moved to Sydney, and the whereabouts of the newsstand workers in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他隨後結束營業，遷至悉尼，並在林暋的報刊亭幫工。

sentences.english: Business was good enough to hire a helper.
sentences.chinese: 生意紅火，還僱了個幫工。

sentences.english: His helper was just saying to him, "Brother Cao, this one is really meaty?"
sentences.chinese: 幫工說，“曹大哥，這隻狗的肉可真多啊？

definition: to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to have no cares/to be carefree
to make trouble out of nothing
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to store/to have sth in storage
